subject: Learning
title: Gutenberg and the Printing Revolution
description: A fast breakdown of Gutenberg and the Printing Revolution for builders.

hook.text: Before 1450, a single book cost as much as a house. Then Gutenberg changed everything.

buildup.text: The printing press made books affordable. By 1500, over 20 million volumes had been printed in Europe.

discovery.text: Cheap books meant self-education became possible. You no longer needed a monk or professor to learn.

twist.text: The Church lost its monopoly on knowledge. The Reformation, fueled by printed pamphlets, followed within decades.

climax.text: Literacy rates climbed for the first time in a thousand years. The printing press democratized learning.

punchline.text: One invention turned knowledge from a privilege into a commodity.

quiz.question: How did Gutenberg's printing press transform education?
options: It made books affordable and enabled self-education at scale
